Class QuestionPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • QuestionPlayer

  • public class QuestionPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    This is you, the player. The player is given the entire database of objects to begin with. Then, the player asks a sequence of queries until ready to guess. Most of the work, however, is delegated to the QuestionTree.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QuestionPlayer(java.util.ArrayList<QuestionObject> objects)
      This constructor builds a new question tree, based on the objects with which it is initialized.

      This method delegates the query to the tree.

      This method checks if the player is ready to guess (i.e.

      This method updates the tree according to the given query and answer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuestionPlayer

        public QuestionPlayer(java.util.ArrayList<QuestionObject> objects)
        This constructor builds a new question tree, based on the objects with which it is initialized.
        Parameters:
        objects - the objects with which the tree will be initialized with

    • Method Detail

      • readyToGuess

        public boolean readyToGuess()
        This method checks if the player is ready to guess (i.e. when there is only one possible object left in the tree).
        Returns:
        true if there is only one possible object left in the tree, false otherwise

      • guessObject

        public java.lang.String guessObject()
        This method returns the single guess object when there is only one object left in the tree.
        Returns:
        the name of the only object left in the tree

      • nextGuess

        public Query nextGuess()
        This method delegates the query to the tree. The tree is responsible for finding a good query to return.
        Returns:
        a query

      • update

        public void update(Query query,
                   boolean answer)
        This method updates the tree according to the given query and answer. This method is delegated to the tree.
        Parameters:
        query - that was performed
        answer - whether it was satisfied or not by the chosen object
